word:
A preliminary examination by Dr. G. E. Klingerman was followed by a more thorough examination by means of the X-ray, and this revealed unmistakably an intracapsular fracture of the left femur. It 
                                                                           443
was of course impossible to determine when the break in the bone had taken place,-- whether before the fall, thus causing Mrs. White to drop to the floor, or as the result of the fall.
